intro: Polygonum amphibium f. aquaticum, commonly known as the marsh knotweed, is a variant of the common knotgrass. It is a herbaceous perennial plant that thrives in wetland environments, often found in marshes, pond edges, and along streams. The plant has slender, erect stems that are usually reddish in color, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a waxy coating. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, and it is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes. This plant plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
